Irish: Ní maith liom ...ar chor ar bith.
Ní maith liom ar chor ar bith é.
English: I don't like it at all.

Irish: Ní maith liom ar chor ar bith iad.
English: I don't like them at all.
ASKING SOMEONE WHETHER THEY LIKE SOMETHING
Do you like... ? (when speaking to more than one person)
When replying to the question An maith leat ...? there's no need to use liom when saying yes or no.

Irish: Ní maith liom ar chor ar bith é.
English: I don't like it at all.
Having replied to the question An maith leat ...? you may wish to return the same question.
You can do this in two ways:

Irish: Is maith liom snagcheoil ach is fearr liom ceol traidisiúnta.
English: I like jazz but I prefer traditional music.
ASKING WHETHER SOMETHING IS ANY GOOD

Irish: An bhfuil an fíon seo maith?
An bhfuil maith ar bith sa ...?
An bhfuil maith ar bith sa bhialann sin?
Phonetic: an whil my ar bee sa via-lann sin?
